reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Despite having a fire in the kitchen, The Glasshouse managed to pull breakfast together superbly. I love this hotel. It's easy, comfortable and the hub of Sligo. I can't imagine visiting and staying anywhere else. I'll be back.
reviews.title: Another fabulous Glasshouse Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern hotel in a great riverside location in the centre of Sligo town. Great breakfast, friendly staff, modern, clean rooms and free underground parking.
reviews.title: Overnighter in Sligo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: must say i was rather disappointed during my stay in this hotel this week!!..one was room access!!..two..no food available ..three.. water in toilet,shower,sink was brown!!..and finally when i approached to the reception to check-out,they were seeking for payment!!..which was unbelievable!!.. cause i had already paid at the start of my stay..as usual they said it was because of unfortunate circumstances...so slow they (the glasshouse) in correcting the problems they were!!it was me that was unfortunate!!...4 star hotel..more like 4 stars in problems!!...so it pays to check that wheresoever you are staying..check that its problem free!!
reviews.title: check before staying in !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is lovely we were very pleased with our stay
reviews.title: FABULOUS HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the rooms are fresh and clean and the hotel staff are lovely
reviews.title: Very mediocre 4* - shabby without the chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very good central hotel, close to everything in the town. However, NOT a 4 star hotel. We arrived and the bedclothes were dirty and old, there was a large stain on the light green carpet in the middle of the room, the light green fabric chair was covered in stains, the curtain was hanging off the rail, we tried to fix but it was broken completely. The curtain was also stained. Granted the hotel is extremely busy, but its lack of care and attention to its decor and housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired. We did complain because lets face it, who wants to sleep in a dirty bed!!! The duty manager, Niall, was fantastic. He dealt with the situation very professionally. There were no free rooms so he had the room cleaned and bed re made with fresh sheets straight away. Apologised for the inconvenience, it was obvious he was completely embarrassed by the lack of housekeeping. Its just a pity such a great building and central location hotel is not looked after the way it should be.
reviews.title: Certainly NOT a 4 star hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a gem. the staff in all departments are exceptional,helpful and friendly.I could not rate the hotel high enough and the food good at reasonable prices.Bar prices high as all over Ireland not their fault i expect
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at the Glasshouse last night, arrived late but hotel was still busy ,our reservation was correct and gentleman on reception checked us in very fast and was really helpful, Room was very spacious and very clean, slippers and dressing gowns were provided,our room overlooked the river,Had an excellent nights sleep and in the morning Buffet Breakfast was excellent, Staff were friendly and helpfull, Checkout again was very efficient no delay, I would recommend this hotel to anyone, location is fantastic right in the Heart of Sligo
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: booked this hotel at very short notice- Manager that we met ( didnt get his name) was fantastic- very helpful and professional. I was upset as just checked out of other hotel that I was not happy with and spent a brillant relaxing, comfortable night at the Glasshouse. Room was large and spotless with lovely view over river, had really nice dinner and great value. Staff at this hotel are really nice and seem to have a happy work environment and are really helpful. Thanks to everyone, especially manager that we met on arrival and also duty manager Niall. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is staying in Sligo- I have visit most others and would say this is the nicest.
reviews.title: great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Glasshouse hotel in Sligo at the beginning of April 2012 . It stands on the site of the former Silver Swan hotel and as the name implies it is a modern building with a lot of glass giving it a bright and airy atzmosphere .It enjoys a wonderful location on the banks of the river Garavogue and in the very centre of Sligo .
reviews.title: 3 night April break in Slogo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have had a pleasant short break in this hotel and are happy to pass on our positive opinion.It has a central position which suited our purposes very well. The hotel is situated on the banks of the river Garavogue and our bedroom 220 had a river view and a small balcony which was just delightful.I suggest that you ask for a river view as our friends did not have such a pleasant view from their bedrooms.
reviews.title: Great central hotel .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception was busy when we arrived but Lynn, the receptionist was competent and helpful.Like some others we had a bit of difficulty finding the car park which was fairly full and required a good bit of effort to get into one of the available spaces,That was our only complaint.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in lovely town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a very good buffet service with lots of fresh fruit and a good selection of cooked food. Nice coffee too.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We did not dine in as we had found a marvellous pub nearby - Hargadons - which had a jazz band(It was Jazz week) and excellent pub grub.Plus the Hargadon owners also have their own vineyard in the Languedoc and we had some of their excellent and well-priced wine!
reviews.title: the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nearby we had some coffee and wonderful home baked scones and pastries in Lyons' Cafe above Lyons ' drapery shop and this had been recommended by Lynn in the hotel when I asked for such a place. One of our group had scones and tea in the Glasshouse the day before and was not happy with the quality!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great rooms and good value right in the middle of Sligo - only gripe was i was expecting the food to be of a higher standard in the restaurant given its 2 rosettes but it was average at best. Having said that it is a well designed and well run hotel with great rooms which are amongst the cleanest i have been in.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location, right in the center, is great to visit the city, and the free underground parking lot makes things even better. However, the food was the worst we have had in our Irish trip and we could not slip well at all because both the hotel aisle is very noisy and the bed itself made annoying noise every move we made. Also, the room was quite hot and the floor was not very clean. Finally, the Wi-Fi connection is free only in the lobby, where, by the way, is quite weak.
reviews.title: Great location, but quite disappointing, overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed just one night at The Glasshouse. Great location for accessing shops, pubs and restaurants in central Sligo. Parking very convenient and free. Staff were really friendly and engaged at every opportunity. The colurs and patterns are a bit mad but as long as you are expecting it to be like that, its fine. Room was very spacious and bed was huge! Breakfast good. Not a conventional hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location on the Garavogue River

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were met at reception by a friendly woman who took a few minutes to check us in. The price was very reasonable too. The room was a great size with a comfortable bed and very clean, fabulous view of Sligo and relaxing sounds of the river outside our window. The tv was up to date with some functions on it that i could not grasp but we were more worried about the bar than watching tv! The bar was very modern with lots of seating areas and very friendly staff. We got back to the hotel after the nightclub and the night porter kept the residents bar open into the early hours with only 4 of us drinking which i thought was very decent of him he was also very friendly! We didnt make it for breakfast but had lunch instead in the restaurant which was fabulous. The food was amazing with another fantastic view of the river.
reviews.title: Just what we needed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: I will definitely be staying again.
reviews.title: Super Hotel & Super Location
